quest.name: Sage Council
journal: Urianger appears to be tallying the Loporrits in preparation for an imminent departure.

With all Loporrits present and accounted for, Urianger insists that the group return to Sharlayan Hamlet, so as to be ready when the time comes to take flight. Seeing the wisdom in this, they reluctantly agree, despite their niggling curiosity about every aspect of Etheirys.

An overwhelmed Growingway is distressed by how the Loporrits' efforts to create a hospitable environment pale in comparison to your star's natural beauty. As he bemoans his failure to complete his life's duty, Thancred arrives and mentions that Labyrinthos's people are feeling none too confident about their own work. Recognizing an opportunity to address both issues, Urianger suggests that Growingway offer counsel to one such researcher based on his expertise in constructing lunar environments─and the Loporrit hesitantly says that he will try.

The troubled researcher doubts whether his design for the ship's gravitational systems is good enough to keep its contents and passengers anchored throughout the exodus. Happily, Growingway has a number of insights to offer on this matter, and the pair are soon engaged in deep conversation. With one success now assured, Urianger asks that you seek out additional distressed souls who might benefit from the Loporrits' counsel.

You speak with a number of Sharlayan Hamlet's residents, who show varying degrees of distress over the impending crisis. Those who stand to find reassurance in the Loporrits' experience are sent to Urianger, to be paired with appropriate members of the delegation.
Urianger is pleased by the number of people who have turned up to receive counsel, and asks that you wait and see how the Loporrits get on. Your presence is sure to encourage them.

Thanks to Urianger's skill in pairing the right Loporrit with the right person, many are soon joyfully engaged in conversation with Sharlayans. To his surprise, however, the next to arrive seeking assistance are Wilfsunn and Bloewyda─father and mother to none other than the dearly departed Moenbryda. Overcome by emotion, Urianger has naught but stammered apologies to offer them at first, though it soon transpires that they do not blame him in the least for their daughter's death, and have in fact been worrying over him much as they would their own child since they fell out of touch. At last, Urianger tearfully accepts Bloewyda's embrace, and affirms that he can feel Moenbryda's spirit with him, even now.

Urianger insists that he is fine, and in fact feels grateful to have met Wilfsunn and Bloewyda again now that he has come into his own alongside his fellow Scions. Moenbryda would surely smile to see the man he has become.
objectives: Seek out troubled souls in Sharlayan Hamlet.

dialogue.name: LIVINGWAY
dialogue.text: Where have you and Cookingway been!? If the two of you have been engaged in pursuits of an educational nature, you should've taken me, too! I am the leader, after all.

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: Oh...there you are. <yawn> Have the others finished talking about rain-making wotsits yet?

dialogue.name: SINGINGWAY
dialogue.text: Not to rub it in, but we had the most fantastic time while you were away! Urianger was able to obtain all manner of meteorological data for us to pore over. I'll be sure to put my newfound knowledge to good use once we return to the moon.

dialogue.name: SINGINGWAY
dialogue.text: It's my duty to make your journey as comfortable as possible, though there's no telling how long it will be. A hundred years? A thousand? Hmm... Probably closer to five thousand, give or take.

dialogue.name: COOKINGWAY
dialogue.text: Mmm, muffins... I wonder if this is how Puddingway felt the first time Urianger made pudding?

dialogue.name: COOKINGWAY
dialogue.text: Though I'm not sure that actually was pudding, come to think of it. Something about it seemed a bit...off...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Forename. I trust thy time at Meryall Agronomics did...<cough>...bear fruit?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Our own efforts, too, were rewarded─we now possess an embarrassment of educational riches.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: No doubt our guests' relentless pursuit of knowledge could occupy them─and us─for a fortnight. Alas, time is of the essence.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Let us return to Sharlayan Hamlet forthwith. I shall gladly attend to each and every Loporrit there, should further questions within my power to answer arise.

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: Aw...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: The Loporrits want for activities and stimulation, but I struggle to conceive of how to busy them whilst we wait...

dialogue.name: LIVINGWAY
dialogue.text: Oh, no, there was nowhere in particular I was hoping to go.

dialogue.name: LIVINGWAY
dialogue.text: I simply wish to see, hear, feel, and think as much as I possibly can while we're here... Hmm? What is that look for? What did I say?

dialogue.name: SINGINGWAY
dialogue.text: That was ever so delightful! And with this much information, I can fine-tune the moon's environs for your people's comfort! It's surprisingly tricky to estimate the appropriate temperature settings for beings so lacking in fur...

dialogue.name: COOKINGWAY
dialogue.text: Why did I not ask Jebke how to make carrot muffins!? We could have had baked goods bursting with happiness...

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: Siiigh...

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: Yes, Forename, that was indeed me verbalizing a sigh to express my emotional state. Do you want to know why?

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: Because I saw the reconstructed environmental data for Etheirys at Logistikon Alpha, that's why!

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: A forest so lovely, and so...so...leafy. Are all of your forests like that?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: The Black Shroud is quite leafy indeed, and a place of utmost tranquility.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: They're verdant, at least. The trees of Dravania stand particularly proud.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You should see the forests of the First─one was purple!

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: Gasp! Gasp, I say!

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: With a star so wonderful, it comes as no surprise that you're reluctant to leave it behind. I was a fool to think otherwise─to assume that the moon was something worth being proud of.

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: How ridiculous we must seem to you. Trying so hard, yet achieving so little...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Not at all. Thy works are no less worthy for their uniqueness.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: (-???-)I thought I heard tiny voices.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Thancred!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: How didst thou fare?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Oh, I was able to glean a fair bit from the researchers while helping to move their cargo.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Preparations have proceeded without interruption here, despite news of the coming end. We have the Forum's leadership to thank for that.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: That doesn't mean people aren't worried, though. Quite the opposite.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Knowing disaster could strike at any moment, they hurry to complete their work, equally aware that a single error could be the difference between life and death. And we can hardly tell them there's no cause for concern...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Perhaps not... Though aided by our goodly Growingway, we may yet find other ways to lighten their burden.

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: M-Me!? Be of use to...to people? I'm honored that you would think me so capable, but I'm not sure that I'm up to the challenge...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Nevertheless, I believe in thee.

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: If you say so, I... I suppose it can't hurt to try.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I passed someone moping in the western plaza that looked to be in need of a helping paw. Perhaps you might start with him?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: 'Tis as good a place as any. Come.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: You'd best go with them. I don't think Urianger misjudged him, but Growingway does look like he could use some emotional support.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I still have work to complete elsewhere. I trust that I won't return to find any Loporrits in tears...

dialogue.name: WORRIEDRESEARCHER04445
dialogue.text: Oh... Can I help you?

dialogue.name: WORRIEDRESEARCHER04445
dialogue.text: ...It is you who would help me? Is my anxiety truly so obvious?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: A burden shared is a burden eased. Pray, tell us of thy troubles.

dialogue.name: WORRIEDRESEARCHER04445
dialogue.text: Those little fellows do look like good listeners...

dialogue.name: WORRIEDRESEARCHER04445
dialogue.text: I'm an engineer, you see. And what they say of the ship─that it's the sum of decades of Sharlayan ingenuity, that it's built with peerless Allagan technology─is all true, but...

dialogue.name: WORRIEDRESEARCHER04445
dialogue.text: I know─I know─that none of that's a guarantee.

dialogue.name: WORRIEDRESEARCHER04445
dialogue.text: We've never before launched a star-faring vessel─let alone flown it in the great expanse. All the tests we've run have been on the ground!

dialogue.name: WORRIEDRESEARCHER04445
dialogue.text: Only operational personnel and cargo will be aboard for the first voyage, but even so... If it fails us then, what can we do? And if it doesn't, it could fall apart on the next flight, or the one after that...

dialogue.name: WORRIEDRESEARCHER04445
dialogue.text: We've done everything we can to prevent that from happening, but it hardly matters. We thought the aetherburner's design was flawless, too, and look how that turned out...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Thou art familiar with these most daunting technologies, and thus dost thou hold the power to allay his fears.

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: Oh! I, er...I'm not sure about that, but, well...

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: Maybe you could tell me if there are any aspects of the ship's design that you're especially worried about?

dialogue.name: WORRIEDRESEARCHER04445
dialogue.text: Our ability to walk about and perform our tasks, for one. I've devised a means by which to employ Gravity─a spatiotemporal spell─to regulate the environment, but what if it's not strong enough? What if everyone floats away and begins crashing into things as soon as we've left the star?

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: Aha, gravitation! Maybe I can be of help after all!

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: Up there is not so different from down here, you see. The same rules apply, and if you consider them as part of one great big cosmos rather than separate places...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I suspect both parties shall find comfort in this conversation.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Yet if Thancred's tale be true, still others would benefit from insights born of experience.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Might I prevail upon the Loporrits to attend them?

dialogue.name: LIVINGWAY
dialogue.text: An excellent idea, if I do say so myself! There is naught we'd like more than to ease the hearts of the fine people of Etheirys─and learn more about them while we're at it.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Full glad am I to hear it. Gather thy companions and bring them hither.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Forename, thou hast a gift for finding souls in need of succor.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Pray seek thee out the distressed and the apprehensive, and inform them that help is at hand.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I shall await them here, that I might introduce each to a suitable Loporrit.

dialogue.name: LIVINGWAY
dialogue.text: Oh, I do so look forward to that. A place for every Loporrit, and every Loporrit in their place!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: The Final Days doubtless weigh heavy upon the minds of many in Sharlayan Hamlet, pillars of the exodus as they are.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Pray, bring them hither.

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: Yes, precisely! However, it would also be prudent to have a redundant system in the event of failure...

dialogue.name: WORRIEDRESEARCHER04445
dialogue.text: Thank heavens I asked you!

dialogue.name: PERSONONE04445
dialogue.text: By the gods, my chest is tight... Am I dying? Is this what dying feels like?

dialogue.name: PERSONONE04445
dialogue.text: Oh! Do pardon me─I didn't see you there. There is no cause for concern, I assure you.

dialogue.name: PERSONONE04445
dialogue.text: No cause for concern...even though we may need to depart at any moment...and if the hull I designed buckles under the strain, the entire vessel may explode on launch, claiming countless lives and dooming all mankind...but that is highly unlikely! Yes, yes, highly unlikely... Highly...

dialogue.name: PERSONONE04445
dialogue.text: ...Our visitors can help me triple check for structural flaws, you say? Why, that would be wonderful! I'm breathing more easily already.

dialogue.name: PERSONTWO04445
dialogue.text: Consult our collaborators? I suppose that would be more effective than sitting here brooding.

dialogue.name: PERSONTWO04445
dialogue.text: I'm attempting to calculate how much cargo we can consolidate into fewer trips, should the aetherburner make our original estimates unfeasible─but there are simply too many variables. I feel as if my brow will turn inside out...

dialogue.name: PERSONTWO04445
dialogue.text: But perhaps our lunar associates will have more insight into how much weight constitutes too much weight for our purposes. Thank you for letting me know.

dialogue.name: PERSONTHREE04445
dialogue.text: Just leave me to my misery... The Forum can appoint someone else...

dialogue.name: PERSONTHREE04445
dialogue.text: <sigh> I apologize─I simply don't know what to do. How am I supposed to pilot the ark if I'm already falling apart under the pressure?

dialogue.name: PERSONTHREE04445
dialogue.text: You know a starship pilot that I might speak with? Truly?

dialogue.name: PERSONTHREE04445
dialogue.text: Well, then, there's no time to waste! They can help me prepare for this monumental task...

dialogue.name: PERSONFOUR04445
dialogue.text: ...What am I thinking about? The medical facilities on the ship, of course.

dialogue.name: PERSONFOUR04445
dialogue.text: I designed them with the assistance of our sages and chirurgeons, but to imagine every illness or injury that one might face in that great expanse is beyond any of us. To say nothing of the effects that living out there indefinitely might have on the body...

dialogue.name: PERSONFOUR04445
dialogue.text: ...The crew from the moon! Why did I not think of that?

dialogue.name: PERSONFIVE04445
dialogue.text: Blasted assistants! Where have they gone off to at a time like this?

dialogue.name: PERSONFIVE04445
dialogue.text: Beg pardon, but I have not the time for idle chitchat. I need to reconfirm that aether levels are consistent throughout the vessel's machinery, and it seems I shall have to do so single-handedly! I swear, when I find those assistants of mine...

dialogue.name: PERSONFIVE04445
dialogue.text: ...The Loporrits are willing to help? Why didn't you say so?

dialogue.name: PERSONFIVE04445
dialogue.text: At least they won't moan about how they “checked two dozen times already” and “haven't slept in weeks.” Lazy sods...

dialogue.name: PERSONSIX04445
dialogue.text: ...My face? What's wrong with my─ Ow! Perhaps I am a bit tense.

dialogue.name: PERSONSIX04445
dialogue.text: I was tasked with ensuring that the proper fauna─and only the proper fauna─are brought with us to the moon. However, the suitability of a few species is still under debate, and I can hardly make the decision myself when I know so little about the environment up there...

dialogue.name: PERSONSIX04445
dialogue.text: Including the Loporrits in our discussions is a wonderful idea! I absolutely will, thank you! Perhaps their biology itself might offer some clue, as well...

dialogue.name: PERSONSEVEN04445
dialogue.text:
Fifty-six bunches of weeds in the ground,
Fifty-six bunches of weeds.♪
Rip one out, add to the mound,
Fifty-five bunches of weeds in the─

dialogue.name: PERSONSEVEN04445
dialogue.text: Eep! I-I'm not neglecting my duties, I swear!

dialogue.name: PERSONSEVEN04445
dialogue.text: I was in need of a little break, you see, but then I found myself unable to relax at all, so I went on a walk, and then I noticed these weeds, and...

dialogue.name: PERSONSEVEN04445
dialogue.text: ...Pleasant conversation partners and oh-so fuzzy? Goodness me, that does sound like a much better way to relax!

dialogue.name: PERSONEIGHT04445
dialogue.text: Have you heard anything of what's on the moon?

dialogue.name: PERSONEIGHT04445
dialogue.text: I have no doubt that we can make it up there, but the “searching for a new star” part of the plan sounds awfully vague to me.

dialogue.name: PERSONEIGHT04445
dialogue.text: I asked the Forum, but they will only tell us that our collaborators “have everything under control.” Forgive me, but I don't feel particularly safe wandering through the sea of stars on gods-know-what made by gods-know-who!

dialogue.name: PERSONEIGHT04445
dialogue.text: You mean to say that I can speak with them directly!? Amazing! I hope they like questions...

dialogue.name: PERSONNINE04445
dialogue.text: Concerns? Nay, there's no point in worrying at this stage. It'll only make the work go that much the slower.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This woman seems to be coping well.

dialogue.name: PERSONNINE04445
dialogue.text: All we can do is keep at it.

dialogue.name: PERSONTEN04445
dialogue.text: Aha...haha! The end of the world is nigh, yet the work goes no faster! Schedules are such temperamental things─feasible one moment, utter bollocks the next!

dialogue.name: PERSONTEN04445
dialogue.text: And yet...I've never felt so alive!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This one is beyond your help. Only sleep can save her now.

dialogue.name: PERSONTEN04445
dialogue.text: I can't stop now─I've got my second wind! Or my second-second wind... Hahaha!

dialogue.name: PERSONELEVEN04445
dialogue.text: You! Yes, you, you idiot! Have you seen an envelope lying about?

dialogue.name: PERSONELEVEN04445
dialogue.text: This imbecile refuses to give me the alchemic I ordered without that bloody slip of parchment!

dialogue.name: PERSONELEVEN04445
dialogue.text: Unless your friends have a spell to make me remember where I dropped my damned envelope, I doubt they'll be more help than you... And you've wasted enough of my time already!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: It would be unfortunate for all involved to inflict this man upon the Loporrits.

dialogue.name: PERSONELEVEN04445
dialogue.text: Did I drop it on the path? Did I leave it at home? Why in the seven blasted hells can I never find things when I need them!?

dialogue.name: PERSONTWELVE04445
dialogue.text: Apologies, but I am awaiting a delivery. Whatever it is will have to wait.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: It seems this gleaner is too busy to chat, for his benefit or otherwise.

dialogue.name: PERSONTWELVE04445
dialogue.text: If it's urgent, you had best ask a different gleaner.

dialogue.name: PERSONTHIRTEEN04445
dialogue.text: Is anything bothering me? Well, I've been loading cargo for bells now, so my back feels like a voidsent's played it as a piano. My feet and knees as drums and cymbals, too.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This gleaner seems fine, if in need of a break.

dialogue.name: PERSONTHIRTEEN04445
dialogue.text: Ah, sitting. From the mightiest emperor to the lowliest peasant, who doesn't enjoy a good sit?

dialogue.name: PERSONFOURTEEN04445
dialogue.text: How might I help you?

dialogue.name: PERSONFOURTEEN04445
dialogue.text: My, what a lovely idea!

dialogue.name: PERSONFOURTEEN04445
dialogue.text: I too noticed people becoming...rather tense, so I rushed out to pluck some fresh and fragrant tea leaves! Now I need only track down a hundred or so cups...

dialogue.name: PERSONFOURTEEN04445
dialogue.text: But don't you worry─I can manage. I hope your plan to cheer everyone up goes well!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This woman is doing better than you are!

dialogue.name: PERSONFOURTEEN04445
dialogue.text: When plucked early, this particular cultivar's leaves are redolent with a scent that clears the mind and soothes the soul. Precisely what my hardworking colleagues need.

dialogue.name: PERSONFIFTEEN04445
dialogue.text: Worries, worries... No, I believe I'm fine, thank you! I've been confiding in my colleagues, and it's helped a lot. Can't recommend it enough.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This researcher already has the support she needs.

dialogue.name: PERSONFIFTEEN04445
dialogue.text: It's a stressful time, of course, but having colleagues I can count on makes all the difference.

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: Forename! He said... He said he was glad we spoke! And he thanked me...

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: <sniff> It was all worth it after all, wasn't it? E-Even the mistakes we made. Because now, we can tell them what not to do...

dialogue.name: WORRIEDRESEARCHER04445
dialogue.text: Growingway has been a godssend. I can look upon what we've built with clarity now.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Behold, Forename...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Through thine efforts, word hath spread throughout Labyrinthos.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Verily, to a far greater number than we anticipated. Livingway doth gather more Loporrits as we speak.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I shall assign each in accordance with their skills, that new bonds of friendship might be forged.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Should greater matters require not thine attentions...watch over them, I prithee.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I pray that Livingway is joyed to see so many heartened souls when she doth return.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Remind me to invite Urianger for a drink, when we have a moment to breathe. We're long overdue for one.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: We can raise a glass to Moenbryda.

dialogue.name: LIVINGWAY
dialogue.text: I was so busy asking questions about Etheirys that I never thought to ask more about Urianger...

dialogue.name: LIVINGWAY
dialogue.text: I'd like to, but where would I begin?

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: I assure you that my fellow Loporrits are equally excited to have this opportunity. They were humming the whole way here!

dialogue.name: SINGINGWAY
dialogue.text: We spent so long gazing at this star. Wondering, and hoping... But to be here now, to walk among the people, to be a part of their lives and know that we've made a difference... It's so much more than I ever dreamed.

dialogue.name: COOKINGWAY
dialogue.text: Goodness me, I've never felt like there was too little time before! There are so many people to talk to, so many things to learn...

dialogue.name: WILFSUNN
dialogue.text: The classical Roegadyn language isn't so different from Eorzean. Did you ever wonder why we named our daughter “moon's bride”?

dialogue.name: WILFSUNN
dialogue.text: When I first held her, the moon was shining silver and full─the whole world seemed aglow. I knew it had chosen her─that she would be a beacon of that selfsame light.

dialogue.name: WILFSUNN
dialogue.text: Of course, we'd later hear our fair share of jokes about how we ought to have gone for “sun” instead, with how bright and stubborn she was. But fiery as my Moenbryda was, she was always kind. Kind and gentle.

dialogue.name: BLOEWYDA
dialogue.text: Oh... You must be one of the Scions, correct?

dialogue.name: BLOEWYDA
dialogue.text: Thank you for caring for my daughter. The time she spent with you was all too short, but I know she was proud to have you as comrades.

dialogue.name: BLOEWYDA
dialogue.text: Urianger is too, I'm sure. And I certainly feel better for knowing he has good friends to look after him. See that he comes home from time to time, will you?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Oh, Forename... Be assured that I am fine. I am...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Full glad to see them, too, after so very long. Gladder still that it was in your company. As difficult as it was to accept their kindness, 'twould have been far harder had I faced them alone...
